keyboardNavigation.notes: Input is keyboard accessible. Focus states clearly visible via bottom border. CONCERN: If rightSlot contains interactive button, keyboard accessibility needs verification.

screenReaderSupport.notes: Uses semantic input element. MISSING: No aria-label or label prop - screen readers can't identify purpose. MISSING: No error message text. MISSING: Icons not properly labeled or hidden. CRITICAL: Without accessible name, fails basic screen reader requirements.

visualAccessibility.notes: Uses design tokens for theming. Focus state has clear bottom border. Error state uses red border. ISSUE: Icon animations (scale/opacity) don't respect prefers-reduced-motion. NEEDS VERIFICATION: Placeholder contrast, AAA contrast (7:1).

ariaCompliance.notes: Uses semantic HTML. MISSING: aria-label for accessible name. MISSING: aria-describedby for instructions. MISSING: aria-invalid for error state. Should follow WAI-ARIA Search design pattern.

strengths: Keyboard accessible via Tab and standard input controls
Focus states with clear visual indicators (bottom border)
Disabled state properly styled with visual feedback
Left/right slot support for icons (search, clear, etc.)
Icon animations provide visual feedback on focus (scale and opacity)
Placeholder text fades out on focus for better UX
Error state with red border for visual distinction
Smooth transitions for all state changes
Auto-generates ID from name prop if not provided
Works with all input modalities (mouse, touch, keyboard)

issuesFound.impact: Screen reader users cannot identify the purpose of the search input
issuesFound.suggestion: Add aria-label prop support and documentation. Example: <SearchInput aria-label='Search products' />. Alternatively, provide label prop support similar to TextInput.

issuesFound.description: Icon slots not properly labeled for assistive technology
issuesFound.impact: Screen reader users don't know the purpose of icons in left/right slots
issuesFound.suggestion: Add aria-hidden='true' to decorative icons, or provide aria-label for interactive icons (like clear button). Document icon slot accessibility requirements.

issuesFound.description: Error state is visual only, no error message text
issuesFound.impact: Screen reader users and users with color blindness may not be aware of error state
issuesFound.suggestion: Add errorMessage prop similar to TextInput. Provide text description of error, not just visual indicator.

issuesFound.impact: Users who prefer reduced motion will still see scale/opacity animations which may cause discomfort
issuesFound.suggestion: Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) to disable icon animations. Set transition to 'none' when user prefers reduced motion.

issuesFound.impact: Users with low vision may not be able to read placeholder text
issuesFound.suggestion: Verify placeholder color (gray[400]) meets 4.5:1 contrast ratio against background.

issuesFound.description: Enhanced contrast (7:1) not verified for AAA
issuesFound.impact: Users with low vision may have difficulty reading input text
issuesFound.suggestion: Verify all text colors meet 7:1 contrast ratio for AAA compliance. Test default, hover, focus, error, and disabled states.

recommendations: Add aria-label prop - Allow consumers to provide accessible name for search input
Add label prop support - Provide visible label option similar to TextInput for better UX
Add errorMessage prop - Provide text error messages, not just visual indicators
Add hintText prop - Allow help text for search syntax or examples
Document icon accessibility - Provide guidelines for making left/right slot icons accessible
Add prefers-reduced-motion support - Disable animations for users who prefer reduced motion
Verify color contrast - Measure placeholder and text colors for AA/AAA compliance
Add aria-describedby - Link to hint text or instructions when provided
Consider autocomplete - Add autocomplete='search' for better browser integration
Test with screen readers - Validate with NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver
Document search pattern - Provide examples of accessible search implementation
Add clear button accessibility - If rightSlot is clear button, ensure it has aria-label='Clear search'
